byline.contributor: Noah Smith contributed reporting from Los Angeles. Susan Beachy, Jack Begg, Doris Burke and Alain Delaquérière contributed research.
byline.original: By SERGE F. KOVALESKI and JOE COSCARELLI

abstract: Career and personal life of pop icon Britney Spears appear to have stabilized under legal conservatorship established after her 2008 psychotic breakdown; arrangement prevents her from making decisions or purchases without approval of her father and lawyer.

headline.print_headline: Is Britney Ready  to Stand Alone?
headline.main: Is Britney Spears Ready to Stand on Her Own?

snippet: For years, the life of one of the world’s most successful pop stars has been controlled by a court-approved conservatorship, designed for people who cannot take care of themselves.
lead_paragraph: For years, the life of one of the world’s most successful pop stars has been controlled by a court-approved conservatorship, designed for people who cannot take care of themselves.
